meanings.definition: To make or become tight or taut.
meanings.sent1: She tried to tauten the rope before climbing.
meanings.sent2: Please tauten the strings on the guitar for better sound.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved tautening the invisible thread.
meanings.sent4: His determination tautened his resolve to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The cold weather caused the fabric to tauten and crack.

meanings.sent1: He needed to tauten the elastic band to keep the papers together.
meanings.sent2: The athlete had to tauten his muscles before the race.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to tauten the dough to prepare the perfect pizza crust.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room seemed to tauten with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: The suspense in the movie tautened as the plot thickened.
